frameDefinitions: A Cognizer carries out an approximate calculation or considers some Evidence so as to arrive at an approximate Value for some Feature of an Item.
The absolute Value of a quantifiable Attribute  of an item is determined by adding up the values for the Attribute of the individuals or parts that make up the item.
The words of this frame describe how a Resource_controller spends money or other Resources for a particular purpose .
A Cognizer computes a Result on the basis of input Numbers by addition.   '
A person (the Cognizer) comes to believe something (the Content), sometimes after a process of reasoning.
A Cognizer has carried out an approximate calculation or considered some Evidence and produced an approximation of the Value of a feature of an Item.
frameExamples: Until 1971, dolphin mortality could be <t>estimated</t> only from analyses of vessels ' logbooks -- and the figures are probably underestimates. CNI
Defence is provided in West Germany by armed forces whose number <t>totals</t> close to half a million men and women
Based on the most recent census I have <t>concluded</t> that most Americans sleep too much.
You can list a <t><fex name='Value'>ballpark figure</fex></t> for shipping and handling.
listRoleDefinitions: The individual who considers evidence or performs calculations to arrive at an approximation.
The feature is a scalar property of the <fen>Item</fen>.
The position or area  on the <fen>Feature</fen> scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> concludes the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses the <fen>Feature</fen> whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> seeks to approximate the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms the estimate of the <fen>Feature</fen>'s <fen>Value</fen>.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> forms their estimate.
The value of an attribute.
The scalar property of a concrete or abstract entity.
A set of numbers that add up to the <fen>Value</fen>.

The <fen>Resource_controller</fen> is the individual whose frugality or generosity is being described. Person typically occurs as the External Argument or, in some cases when <fen>Behavior</fen> is also expressed, in an <ment>of</ment>-PP:
Some specific <fen>Behavior</fen> may be described as frugal or extravagant, rather than attributing the characteristic directly to the <fen>Resource_controller</fen>.
This role is the resource which the <fen>Resource_controller</fen> expends.
The person doing the calculation.
The <fen>Numbers</fen> that are used in the calculation.
The outcome of the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s calculcations.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> operates on the <fen>Numbers</fen>.
The location where the <fen>Cognizer</fen> performs their calculation
Cognizer is the person who comes to believe something.
Words in this frame may occur with a PP headed by <ment>from</ment> which expresses the Evidence on which knowledge or belief is based:
With a target verb, the Content is usually expressed as a finite clausal Complement or an Object NP, and may sometimes be expressed by a PP:

Some verbs in this frame may occur with postverbal Topic expressions: They <t>found out</t> <fex name='Topic'>about us</fex>! More generally verbs in this frame may occur with quantificational nouns followed by Topic expressions:
An act performed by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> which enables them to figure something out.
<fen>Medium</fen> is the text created by the <fen>Cognizer</fen> to communicate that they came to believe a specified <fen>Content</fen>.
The time at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> discovers the <fen>Content</fen>.
The location at which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> realizes the <fen>Content</fen>.
The individual who has considered evidence or performed calculations to produce the approximation.
The position or area  on the feature scale that the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has concluded the <fen>Item</fen> occupies.
The entity that possesses a feature whose <fen>Value</fen> the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated.
A proposition expressing the <fen>Cognizer</fen>'s approximation of a feature's <fen>Value</fen>.
An open proposition for which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has approximated the <fen>Value</fen> of a variable.
The time period during which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> formed the estimate.
The location in which the <fen>Cognizer</fen> has formed their estimate.
listRoleExamples: <fex>The government</fex> estimated the cost of meeting EC water standards at £3-4 billion.

In one march from 42 Street down to Washington Square Park, the crowds were
estimated <fex>in size</fex> from 125000 (NYPD estimate) to over 200000 (march organizers).
Sotheby 's have estimated its value <fex>at $10m-$14m</fex>.
I estimated <fex>the house</fex> at about 60-65% full.
At the time they estimated <fex>there to be as many as four million to the acre</fex>.
Then Sandia estimated <fex>how many people would die and be injured within the first year due to their radiation exposure</fex>.
The US Forest Service estimated <fex>last year</fex> that 45 million piñons have died so far in north-central New Mexico.
<fex>At the London School of Economics</fex> they estimated that China would have to spend 2% of gross. domestic product on higher. education for 15 years
The final tally for 1990 was <fex>199,000</fex> .
During the first three years of drug squad work, <fex>arrests</fex> totaled some sixty-four persons.
Look, you turn those into numbers, and then <fex>592 and 74</fex> total 666, right?
<fex>Jo</fex> is very frugal.
It's thrifty of Jo <fex>to re-use teabags</fex>.
Pat is wasteful <fex>with her time</fex>.
<fex>Sue</fex> realized that Bob was lost.
I have learned <fex>from experience</fex> that poison oak can be painful.
The President learned <fex>that the reporters were hungry</fex>.
The jury learned something terrible <fex>about the suspect</fex>.
<fex>A post-mortem examination</fex> was unable to ascertain the cause of death.
<fex>Back at the tailor's shop</fex>, I deduced that our murderer was not the owner of the kerchief.
<fex>Her</fex> estimation was that they had exported up to 180000 fish.
Sotheby 's estimate of its value was <fex>$10m-$14m</fex>.
He's an engineer and he is supposed to know the estimate <fex>of the house</fex>.
One estimate was <fex>that eventually I had lost about 80% of my blood</fex>.

Galliard decided Rwanda was different, and he went public with his estimate
<fex>of how many people had been killed in a matter of two weeks</fex>.
That is 30000 higher than <fex>last year's</fex> estimate of 2.65 million
